intro: Palicourea plowmanii, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. It is a shrub or small tree native to the Amazon Basin, particularly in Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. Its fruits are fleshy, star-shaped berries that are edible and have a mild, sweet taste. Palicourea plowmanii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
